message_1: Calculate the amount of heat released when 25 g of NaCl is crystallized from a solution at its saturation point. The heat of crystallization of NaCl is -788 J/g.
message_2:
To calculate the amount of heat released when 25 g of NaCl is crystallized, we can use the formula:

q = m × ΔH

where q is the heat released, m is the mass of NaCl, and ΔH is the heat of crystallization.

Given:
m = 25 g (mass of NaCl)
ΔH = -788 J/g (heat of crystallization of NaCl)

Now, plug in the values:

q = 25 g × (-788 J/g)

q = -19700 J

The amount of heat released when 25 g of NaCl is crystallized from a solution at its saturation point is -19,700 J. The negative sign indicates that the heat is released (exothermic process).
